intro: Agalmyla ovata, commonly known as the oval agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Agalmyla ovata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in herbal medicine.
